bore.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make someone feel bored, especially by talking too much about something they are not interested in
bore somebody to death/tears (=make them very bored)
bore.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He’s the sort of person who bores you at parties.
a film that will bore its young audience
I won’t bore you with all the technical details.
bore.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to make a deep round hole in a hard surface
bore.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The machine bores a hole through the cards.
To build the tunnel they had to bore through solid rock.
bore.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if someone’s eyes bore into you, they look at you in a way that makes you feel uncomfortable
bore.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you
bore.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: You’ll find it’s a terrible bore.
bore.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: someone who is boring, especially because they talk too much about themselves or about things that do not interest you
bore.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: He turned out to be a crashing bore  (=used to emphasize that someone is very boring).
bore.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: the measurement of the width of the inside of a long hollow object such as a pipe or the barrel of a gun
bore.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: Take a length of piping with a bore of about 15 mm.
bore.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: a wave of water that moves quickly along a river from the sea at particular times of the year
